intro: Holtzendorffia caracasana, commonly known as the Caracas beauty, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
